v.v: This is what Yahweh says, “Observe what is right, do what is just;
Blessed is the man that does this, and who holds it tightly.
Let no foreigner who has become a follower of Yahweh say,
For this is what Yahweh says, “To the eunuchs who observe my Sabbaths
to them I will set up in my house and within my walls a monument that is better than having sons and of daughters.
Also foreigners who join themselves to Yahweh—
I will bring to my holy mountain and make them joyful in my house of prayer;
this is the declaration of the Lord Yahweh, who gathers the outcasts of Israel—
All you wild beasts of the field, come and devour, all you beasts in the forest!
All their watchmen are blind, they do not understand.
The dogs have big appetites; they can never get enough;
“Come,” they say, “let us drink wine and liquor.

v: for my salvation is near, and my righteousness is about to be revealed.
He observes the Sabbath, not defiling it, and keeps his hand from doing any evil.”
“Yahweh will certainly exclude me from his people.”
The eunuch should not say, “See, I am a dry tree.”
and choose what pleases me, and hold fast my covenant,
I will give them an everlasting monument that will never be cut off.
to serve him, and who love the name of Yahweh, to worship him,
every one who observes the Sabbath and who keeps from defiling it, and who holds fast my covenant—
their burnt offerings and their sacrifices will be accepted on my altar.
For my house will be called a house of prayer for all nations,
I will still gather others in addition to them.”
They are all silent dogs who cannot bark.
They dream, and lying down they love to sleep.
they have all turned to their own way, each one covetous for unjust gain.
Tomorrow will be like today, a day great beyond measure.”
